item.title: Practical Object-Oriented Design in Ruby: Chapter 1
item.description: We’ve read the first chapter from the Practical Object-Oriented Design in Ruby, by Sandi Metz. These are the concepts and links brought up during the discussion: Walking on water and developing software from a specification are easy if both are frozen. Edward V Berard, source is Wikiquote Two cited papers on metrics for design: A metrics suite for object oriented design by Chidamber and Kemerer A validation of object-oriented design metrics as quality indicators by Basili, Briand and Melo The video for the ‘churn’ as a measure:
